Jotunn: This is surprising news indeed... Here are my orders: install
a Loyalty chip in this Windlord. He must be brought under my control!
After that, activate him. He will still think he is a maximal, but he
will think our option is the best one. Try to make him convert
Balistica. If she doesn't join... terminate her. Understood?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Trooper:
> 
> "YEs sir"replied the male while he looked those scary red eyes"One
of the maximals, the somehow useless, it's a femme, her name is
Balistica., I'm not very clear with her backgroud: it seems that she
came her behind someone very important in Cybertron council; she's
actually, funcional and under a high vigilance;  I don't like that she
go around and lost. The other one is a male; his current status is
stasis lock, I guess that it's the best, sir, but he has a tight
vigilance too. Acording with data banks that was taken from the ruins
from he comes, his name is Windlord and was here before that the lost
ones come to this planet and his joined them, and he participates in
most battles before our arrival, in his data banks showed that he an a
femme were Unicron's prisioners, but they ran away, after that his
records are destroyed...  "
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Friday, July 15, 2005 5:46 PM
>   Subject: Re: Balistica up and running
> 
> 
>   The room was dark. The air was damp, as if there was a jungle in it.
>   Yet, at the same time, there was a chilling breeze passing through the
>   room. Then, something moved, and two huge red eyes were looking at the
>   trooper.
> 
>   Jotunn: Tell me more... What are their names, and which is which? What
>   is their potential? Answer me...
